full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 133 of 228 809 LC2VMAX4

1 MR. PAGLIUCA: Your Honor, I'm going to object to the narrative at this point.
2 THE COURT: Sustained.
3 MS. COMEY: We'll move on.
4 Q. Mr. Alessi, you mentioned checklists.
5 A. Yes.
6 Q. What do you mean by checklists?
7 A. Well, I have the instructions and there was a checkmark, check square under each instruction. And different -- different items from -- from the cleanliness of the cars to the shopping list.
8 MR. PAGLIUCA: Again, your Honor, narrative.
9 THE COURT: Sustained.
10 Q. What are the different topics of checklists that you remember seeing in this booklet?
11 A. There were everything. Cleanliness, the way we should address Mr. Epstein, the way we should ask Mr. Epstein, the way we should ask Ms. Maxwell, the way we should be presented ourselves, the way we should not to --
12 MR. PAGLIUCA: Again, your Honor, we're into a narrative here.
13 MS. COMEY: Your Honor, I think he's listing out the checklist. He said that this was at least 30 pages.
14 THE COURT: All right.
15 MR. PAGLIUCA: They are not checklists, your Honor.
16 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300

DOJ-OGR-00012418
